H0.text: Desert is a feature formed east of the Sierra Nevada Mountain Range that results from moist air rising along the western slope of the mountain range.

H1.text: Grassland is the feature formed east of the Sierra Nevada Mountain Range that results from moist air rising along the western slope of the mountain range.

H2.text: Rain forest is the feature formed east of the Sierra Nevada Mountain Range that results from moist air rising along the western slope of the mountain range.

H3.text: Temperate forest is the feature formed east of the Sierra Nevada Mountain Range that is due to moist air rising along the western slope of the mountain range.

A4.text: The desert formed by the rain shadow of the Sierra Nevada that blocks moisture from the Pacific Ocean
